details.title: 48 pc of total COVID-19 deaths concentrated in 25 districts of 8 states: Health Ministry
details.content:
Addressing a press briefing, Union Health Ministry Secretary Rajesh Bhushan said India has recorded the highest number of recoveries from COVID-19 at over 56 lakh and India has also conducted the second highest number of tests in the world at 8.10 crore.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 recoveries in India cross 56.6-lakh mark
details.content:
India's total COVID-19 recoveries have crossed 56.6 lakh. This has boosted the national recovery rate to 84.7%. This sustained high figure is fuelled by 17 states/UTs reporting recovery rate higher than the national average: Union Health Ministry pic.twitter.com/9wOkwd8UMG

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2020

details.title: India to operate two more Vande Bharat flights to China
details.content:
India plans to operate two Vande Bharat flights from Delhi and the Chinese city of Guangzhou on October 23 and 30 to facilitate the travel of Indians stranded due to the COVID-19 lockdowns.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

79 new #COVID19 cases & 50 recoveries reported in Ladakh on 6th October. The number of active cases now stands at 1195 (904 in Leh district and 291 in Kargil district): Department of Information & Public Relations, Ladakh. pic.twitter.com/zlHSmd33RW

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2020

details.title: EDITORIAL | The pros and cons of reopening schools during COVID-19
details.content:
The country recorded over 61,200 cases on Monday and at least 10 states accounted for 75 per cent of the caseload. Would parents send their children to school in the next 10 days under these circumstances? 
(READ FULL EDITORIAL HERE)

details.title: WATCH | This is a war-like situation | Dr Ashok Seth on COVID in India
Nurse-managed domiciliary Covid-19 centres set up in Kerala
details.content:
Being run by staff nurses, DCCCs will replace the Covid First-Line Treatment Centres (CFLTCs). Domiciliary centres admit asymptomatic patients who are unable to opt for home isolation due to psychosocial issues. CFLTCs with less than 100 beds are being converted into DCCCs and those having more facilities into Covid Second Line Treatment Centres (CSLTC).
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India reports 72,049 new cases and 986 deaths in last 24-hours
Centre releases Ayurveda-based COVID-19 treatment protocol despite clinical trials being still underway
details.content:
The Centre on Tuesday recommended the use of common ayurvedic formulations such as Guduchi, Ashwagandha and AYUSH-64 in treating mild and asymptomatic Covid-19 cases even though the clinical trials to ascertain their efficacy against the infectious disease are still underway. 
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

11,99,857 samples tested for #COVID19 on 6th October. Total 8,22,71,654 samples tested in the country up to 6th October: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) pic.twitter.com/nWpwzVS3Ax

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2020

details.title: Former MP Dr Kartikeswar Patra Patra dies of COVID-19
details.content:
Former Balasore MP and eminent writer Dr Kartikeswar Patra succumbed to Covid-19 on Monday night while he was being  shifted to Bhubaneswar by an ambulance. He was 79.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: WATCH | ‘Don't Be Afraid Of COVID’: Trump returns to White House, removes mask
DCGI nod to Phase-1 human trials of 'antisera' with potential to treat COVID-19
details.content:
India's apex drug regulator The Drugs Controller General of India has given permission for conducting Phase-1 human clinical trial for an "antisera" that was developed by injecting inactivated SARS-CoV-2 in horses and can be a potential treatment for COVID-19, ICMR officials said on Tuesday.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Case against Delhi AAP MLA for violating COVID-19 rules
details.content:
Case registered against Delhi AAP MLA Kuldeep Kumar under Epidemic Act: Hathras Superintendent of Police

He had announced on 29th September that he had tested positive for #COVID19 and on 4th October he posted videos of his visit to #Hathras, Uttar Pradesh.

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2020

details.title: With rise in COVID deaths, Delhi's ITO graveyard readies more space for burials
details.content:
In view of the recent increase in the number of deaths due to COVID-19 in the national capital, the Muslim graveyard at central Delhi's ITO has readied 5-6 acres of extra space for burials of casualties caused by the virus. On an average, two-three burials of the virus' victims have been taking place daily but the number has increased in the last few days, said Haji Mian Faiyazuddin, secretary of Qabristan Ahle Islam near Delhi Gate.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Global update | Biden against second debate if Trump still suffers from COVID-19
details.content:
Democratic Party presidential candidate Joe Biden on Tuesday said he is against participating in his second debate with Donald Trump next week if the president still suffers from COVID-19.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

Democratic presidential candidate former Vice President Joe Biden (Photo | AP)

details.title: Unlock 5: Theatres gear up to open amid COVID-19 uncertainty in Vijayawada
details.content:
Though the Centre has announced Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for screening of films during the Unlock 5.0, there is uncertainty prevailing in Vijayawada as several single screen theatre managements are awaiting an assurance from the State government over resumption of operations.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

From Oct 10, second reserv chart in Indian Rlys to be released 30 mins b4 sch train dep as done b4 #COVID19 lockdown. Tkt booking, online & PRS counters, will be available before it. Due to covid, chart was issued 24h b4 dep @XpressBengaluru @NewIndianXpress @KARailway @SouthDvg

details.title: Global update | Sri Lanka bans public gatherings, curfew extended after COVID-19 cluster detected
details.content:
The Sri Lankan authorities have extended police curfew in nearly 20 more areas in the western provincial Gampaha district, the COVID-19 task force said on Wednesday, a day after a new virus cluster of over 800 factory workers was detected in the area.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India's COVID-19 tally crosses 67 lakh mark with 72,049 new cases in last 24 hours
details.content:
India's COVID-19 tally of cases climbed to 67.57 lakh with 72,049 new cases in a day, while 57,44,693 people have recuperated so far pushing the national recovery rate to 85.02 per cent on Wednesday, according to the Union Health Ministry data.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: IN PICS | Delhi doctors on strike
details.content:
Delhi: Resident doctors of Hindu Rao Hospital stage protest alleging non-payment of salaries over last few months.

A doctor says, "We worked for 4 months without salary considering that it was a difficult time for everyone. How long can one work without salary? We're helpless." pic.twitter.com/jKVKgpXUDh

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2020

details.title: Uddhav government allows dabbawalas, consulates staff to travel in local trains
details.content:
Mumbai's dabbawalas and staff of foreign consulates and high commissions have been allowed to travel in local trains which are currently being run only for essential services staff, officials said on Wednesday.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Himachal Pradesh Urban Development Minister Suresh Bhardwaj tests positive for novel coronavirus
details.content: Himachal Pradesh Urban Development Minister Suresh Bhardwaj tested positive for novel coronavirus on Wednesday, a health official said. Bhardwaj is the third Himachal Pradesh minister and ninth MLA in the 68-member state Assembly to have contracted the virus. (READ MORE)

details.title: Delhi High Court declines to entertain PIL for charging of only tuition fees by varsities during COVID-19
details.content: The Delhi High Court Wednesday declined to entertain a PIL seeking guidelines to universities and such institutions to charge only the tuition fee, that too in installments, in view of the prevailing COVID-19 pandemic, and said concessions are not a matter of right.

details.title: 132 cops tested positive for COVID-19 in the last 24 hours: Maharashtra Police
details.content: 132 police personnel tested positive for COVID-19 in the last 24 hours & 4 died, taking total positive cases to 24,386 in the force, including 21,593 recoveries, 2,536 active cases, and 257 deaths: Maharashtra Police

details.title: 1,304 new COVID-19 cases reported in Bihar yesterday
details.content:
1,304 new #COVID19 cases reported in Bihar yesterday, taking the total count of active cases to 12,572: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/KnyKrl5XqF

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2020

details.title: Tripura reports 237 new COVID-19 cases, tally rises to 27,545
details.content: At least 237 more people tested positive for COVID-19 in Tripura on Wednesday, pushing the tally in the state to 27,545, a health department official said. The death toll remained at 298 with no fresh fatalities reported in the last 24 hours, he said.

details.title: COVID: Second infection can be worse than first for some, shows study
details.content: The findings of the study have dashed expectations that second-time infection with coronavirus should be milder. (READ MORE)

details.title: Karnataka conducts over 1 lakh COVID-19 tests in a day, aims at scaling it up to 1.5 lakh
details.content: Karnataka Medical Education Minister K Sudhakar on Wednesday said the state conducted 1.04 lakh coronavirus tests in a single day on October 6, and the government's aim was to increase the number of tests to 1.5 lakh per day.

details.title: Bhadohi CDO dies of COVID in Lucknow hospital
details.content: The chief development officer of Bhadohi district administration died of COVID-19 in a Lucknow hospital on Wednesday, said officials. Bhadohi CDO Vivek Tripathi had recently been tested positive for COVID-19 and was undergoing treatment in a hospital in Lucknow, they said.

details.title: Dasara festival likely to be confined to Mysuru Palace and Chamundi Hills
details.content: As part of checking the spread of COVID-19, Karnataka Health Minister B Sriramulu said on Wednesday there is a general view that the Dasara festival should be confined to the Mysuru Palace and Chamundi Hills this year.

details.title: Arunachal Pradesh Governor Brig (Retd) Dr B D Mishra urges people to support state government in its fight against COVID-19
details.content: Arunachal Pradesh Governor Brig (Retd) Dr B D Mishra on Wednesday urged people to cooperate with the state government in its fight against COVID-19, and iterated that safety protocols have to be strictly followed to stop the spread of the disease.

details.title: Railway Board today gave approval to zones for 39 new trains
details.content:
Railway Board today gave approval to zones for 39 new trains. These services will be introduced as special services from an early convenient date: Ministry of Railways, Government of India pic.twitter.com/UloAYzxZBS

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2020

details.title: Telangana recorded 2,154 COVID-19 cases, 2,239 recoveries and 8 deaths yesterday,
details.content: Telangana recorded 2,154 COVID-19 cases, 2,239 recoveries and 8 deaths yesterday, taking total cases to 2,04,748 including 1,77,008 recoveries, 1,189 deaths and 26,551 active cases: State Health Department

details.title: Government to launch awareness campaign to check spread of coronavirus
details.content: The government would launch a campaign from Thursday to spread awareness on the measures people need to follow to check the spread of coronavirus, Union minister Prakash Javadekar said.

details.title: Nearly 35 percent of Chennai’s population have attended COVID-19 fever camps
details.content: Close to 35 percent of Chennai’s population have attended the COVID-19 fever camps held by the city corporation. Data revealed by the civic body shows that a total of 28,71,934 people have attended the 56,480 camps held in the city till October 6. (READ MORE)

details.title: 60 new COVID-19 cases and 334 cured cases reported in Himachal since 9 pm bulletin yesterday
details.content:
60 new #COVID19 cases & 334 cured cases reported in Himachal Pradesh since 9 pm bulletin yesterday. Total cases in the state stand at 16,343, including 2,862 active cases 13,232 cured and 224 deaths: Department of Health & Family Welfare, Himachal Pradesh pic.twitter.com/0WuRNQhQ4a

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2020

details.title: After wife, Arjun Bijlani's son also tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: Days after Arjun Bijlani's wife Neha Swami tested positive for COVID-19, the actor on Wednesday said his son has also contracted the virus. Bijlani, 37, and Swami got married in 2013 and have a five-year-old son, Ayaan. Swami, 34, tested positive for coronavirus on October 4 and has since been in quarantine. (READ MORE)

details.title: Fresh cases in Kerala breach the 10,000-mark on Wednesday
details.content:
#tniecovidupdate
Fresh cases in Kerala breach the 10,000-mark on Wednesday. 6,161 recover from the disease @MSKiranPrakash @NewIndianXpress @COVID19centre pic.twitter.com/fm1RZLWu0B

— TNIE Kerala (@xpresskerala) October 7, 2020

details.title: No free COVID-19 test in Meghalaya from October 16
details.content: With the Indian Council of Medical Research withdrawing subsidy on testing kits, the Meghalaya government has announced that COVID-19 tests will be charged from next week, Deputy Chief Minister Prestone Tynsong said on Wednesday.

details.title: Fall in containment zones count in Delhi after steady rise since August last week
details.content: After rising steadily for over 40 days, the number of containment zones in the national capital fell to 2,697 on October 6, a marginal dip compared to the figures the previous day, according to official data. Since last week of August, there has been an upward trend in the number of containment zones till October 5 when the count stood at 2,707.

Delhi reports 2,871 new #COVID19, 35 deaths and 3,370 recoveries/discharges/migrations in last 24 hours. Total cases in the state rise to 2,98,107, including 5,616 deaths and 2,70,305 recoveries/discharges/migrations. Active cases stand at 22,186: Government of Delhi pic.twitter.com/q8DgM5p91N

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2020

details.content: Rajasthan records 2151 new COVID-19 cases, 16 deaths, 2078 recoveries and 2068 discharges today. The total cases in the state rise to 1,50,467, including 1590 deaths, 1,27,526 recoveries and 1,26,476 discharges: Government of Rajasthan

details.content: Jammu and Kashmir reports 621 new COVID-19 cases and 2,188 recoveries today, taking the total tally in the Union Territory to 81,097, including 67,684 recoveries and 1,282 deaths. Active cases stand at 12,131: Government of Jammu and Kashmir

details.content: Chandigarh reports 127 new COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of cases to 12,820 including 1,448 active cases, 182 deaths, and 11,190 cured cases: Health Department, UT Chandigarh

details.title: As inaugurations go virtual, Kerala govt saves crores in public money
details.content:
The Chief Minister alone has inaugurated close to 200 projects through the e-platform which otherwise need crores of rupees in expenses if inaugurated physically. Finance minister Thomas Isaac and agriculture minister V S Sunilkumar were next in line with 193 and 185 inaugurations respectively.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.content:

details.title: Kerala govt guidelines for COVID-19
details.content: A maximum of 20 people will be allowed in all places of worship on normal times. Up to 40 people can be accommodated in temples during special poojas & mosques for Friday prayers and churches for Sunday mass: Kerala Chief Minister's Office

details.title: All weekly markets set to open in Delhi
details.content: Now, all weekly markets in Delhi will be opened. Till now, only 2 markets per day per zone were allowed. Cinema halls in Delhi will also be opened from October 15. They have to follow all the guidelines issued by the central government: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal

details.title: Madhya Pradesh records 1639 new COVID19 cases
details.content: Madhya Pradesh records 1639 new COVID19 cases, 30 deaths and 2228 recoveries today. Total cases in the state rise to 1,40,307, including 2518 deaths and 1,20,267 recoveries. Active cases stand at 17,522: Madhya Pradesh health department

details.title: Manipur COVID tally
details.content: 249 new COVID19 cases, 122 recoveries & 2 deaths reported in Manipur today. Total positive cases now at 12,489, including 2,805 active cases, 9,604 recoveries & 80 deaths till date. Recovery rate is 76.89 %: Govt of Manipur

details.title: Gujarat reports 1311 new COVID19 cases
details.content: Gujarat reports 1311 new COVID19 cases, 1414 discharges and 9 deaths today. Total cases in the state rise to 1,46,673, including 1,26,657 discharges and 3531 deaths. Active cases stand at 16,485: Government of Gujarat

details.title: Cinemas to open in Delhi from October 15
details.content: Delhi govt allows cinemas, theatres to reopen with 50 per cent seating capacity from October 15: Official order

details.title: Nonagenarian freedom fighter wins battle against COVID-19
details.content: A 96-year-old freedom fighter has won the battle against COVID-19 and was released from the designated coronavirus hospital in the city where he was under treatment on Wednesday after testing negative, an official said. Loknath Nayak had tested positive for coronavirus on September 29 and was admitted to SUM COVID Hospital on the same day with fever, weakness and breathing problems, a hospital statement said.

details.title: Delhi government's next round of sero-survey to begin on October 15
details.content: The next round of the monthly sero-prevalance survey in the national capital, which got delayed, will now begin from October 15, sources said on Wednesday. The last survey was held from September 1-7 to better assess the COVID-19 situation here and formulate combat strategies.

details.title: Central Railway to run five pairs of special trains in Maharashtra from October 9
details.content: The Central Railway on Wednesday announced that it will run five pairs of special trains in Maharashtra starting October 9. While two of these five special trains will be operated between Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus and Pune, one each will run on CSMT-Nagpur, CSMT-Gondia and CSTM-Solapur routes, the CR said in a release.

details.title: 213 new COVID-19 cases in Noida, tally at 14,377
details.content: Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddh Nagar registered 213 new COVID-19 patients on Wednesday that pushed the district's case tally to 14,377, official data showed. The district's number of active cases rose to 1,533 from 1,434 on Tuesday even as 115 more patients got discharged, according to the data released by the UP Health Department for a 24-hour period.

details.title: 3561 new COVID19 cases reported in UP
details.content: 3561 new COVID19 cases, 4219 discharges and 47 deaths in Uttar Pradesh in the last 24 hours. The total cases in the state rise to 4,24,326, including 3,74,972 discharges and 6200 deaths. Active cases stand at 43,154: Government of Uttar Pradesh

details.title: EC revises norms concerning star campaigners for future polls
details.content: Election Commission revises the norms concerning Star Campaigners for all ongoing and future elections during COVID19 pandemic. Maximum 30 star campaigners for recognized national/state political parties, 15 for unrecognized registered political parties, during the pandemic.
